page.title: 12Housing in North Anston
page.content: The oldest cottages and houses were built with local limestone. The roofs have either red tiles or grey slates. Most of these houses are on Main Street and around The Green. A lot of them used to be farmers' dwellings. They are modernised now. New housing estates have grown around the old part of the village,most of them are brick. The first{council houses}were built in the 1930s but most in the 1950s and 1960s. Recent housing is on Limekilns. They are luxury{private houses}and every house is a different style. Many are built in limestone to blend with the older property. We did a small survey of the types of houses in which junior school children live. The majority live in{semi-detached houses (63%), then{detached}(18%),{terraced (16%), and a few children live in bungalows, farmhouses and cottages.
